headline: Gold Extends Losses as Dollar Pushes Higher on Trade Talks
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Gold extended declines as the dollar swung to a gain and demand for haven assets cooled, with investors also weighing prospects for improving trade relations between the US and the European Union.Most Read from BloombergUAE’s AI University Aims to Become Stanford of the GulfNY Wins Order Against US Funding Freeze in Congestion FightBullion fell 1.5% as signs that Japan may be prepared to adjust debt issuance pushed global bonds and the US currency higher. headline: Citi's Polish unit to sell consumer banking business to Velobank
summary: Citigroup said on Tuesday its Polish unit has agreed to sell its consumer banking business in the country to Velobank, as the Wall Street giant nears the end of a years-long effort to exit non-core...

headline: Apple Shares Face More Pain as Trump’s Tariff Threat Looms
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. shares are coming off their longest selloff in more than three years, as escalating attacks from the White House threaten to further erode the company’s profit outlook, suggesting the stock’s struggles this year are far from over. headline: Citigroup: A Valuation Trap Amid Turnaround Fatigue
summary: Citigroup's persistent structural underperformance and weak return metrics justify its valuation discount. Click here to read why I recommend selling C stock.
